title: Checkmate (The Execution)
coachIntro: The door is closed. The light fades. There is no escape. This is how you win.
summary: Learn the basic checkmating patterns: back rank, helper mate, ladder mate, and how to avoid stalemating your opponent.

tasks.prompt: The enemy King is trapped behind his pawns on the back rank. Deliver the classic back rank mate with your Rook.
tasks.successMessage: Good. His own soldiers became his prison walls.

tasks.prompt: The Queen stands ready, protected by the Bishop. Play the 'Kiss of Death'—checkmate with Queen supported by your helper piece.
tasks.successMessage: Beautiful. The Queen gives the kiss, the Bishop holds her hand.

tasks.prompt: Your two Rooks can build a ladder and push the King to the edge. Play the move that delivers checkmate.
tasks.successMessage: Yes. One Rook cuts off the rank, the other gives the final shove.

tasks.prompt: You can give many checks here, but only one is checkmate. Find the move that ends the game immediately.
tasks.successMessage: Excellent. Do not play hope checks—play the move that kills.

tasks.prompt: You are completely winning. One move is stalemate, the other is checkmate. Do not show mercy—finish correctly.
tasks.successMessage: Good. Mercy is kind in life, but fatal in chess.
